overview: On April 3, 1948, Françoise Sullivan and Jeanne Renaud presented one of Quebec's first modern dance events at Ross House in Montreal. Among the original works presented was Dédale, a solo performance by Françoise Sullivan. In this version, shot in an labyrinthine urban setting, the dancer Ginette Boutin reinterprets the work, revealing its continued topicality.
title: Dédale
